projects.title: Agreflow
projects.summary: Digital Transformation solution for local probions company "Agresource Inc."

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Digital Transofation solution for local probions company Agresource Inc.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Organized the company's document backlogs and organized them into one organized folder structure. Developed the entire system. Implemented user authentication and authorization, document pdf generation, CRUD for storing container van numbers, customers, statement of accounts, billing statements, and affixing e-signatures.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: The final project before I go to the professional world.

projects.title: TCB-MSTSC-DMS
projects.summary: Document Management System for "Thor Custom's Brokerage" and "Mighty Star Trucking Services Company".

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Document Management System that helped the business instantly organize and create statement of accounts and billing statements, and easily access document backlogs.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Organized the company's document backlogs and organized them into one organized folder structure. Developed the entire system. Implemented user authentication and authorization, document pdf generation, CRUD for storing container van numbers, customers, statement of accounts, billing statements, and affixing e-signatures.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: The first fullstack application I've developed on my own for a local company. This project overall helped me see my strengths and weaknesses as a Software Developer wherein I saw the parts that I did great and where I could improve.

projects.title: MTIC-SSA
projects.summary: Single Page application designed for medtech interns to check their shifting schedules with ease.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Assists medical interns to know their shifting schedules easily and provide them insights of previous, current, and future dates. Web application designed for interns to easily check their shifting schedules and provide them insights. Provides interns insights, such as: Immediately knowing their shifts, knowing who their shiftmates are, viewing a summary of all shifts, and checking future or previous shift summaries

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Developed the entire Single Page application.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This is a project and a proof of concept to make shifting schedules more accessible to medical interns, or medical staff themselves. Not only can this be for interns, but for any domain of expertise

projects.title: PAMST
projects.summary: Web application designed to help project managers simulate different decisions during a project, given a project timeline and its resources.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: PAMST is an acronym that stands for "Project Account Management Simulation Tool", which is a tool designed for project managers to simulate different plans of a project and gives them the freedom to tweak different features to acquire ideal outcomes and insights

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Developed Document Versioning, Task Hierarchy, Daily Emails, CRUD for Tasks, Resources & Financials, and Batch Processing.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This is the first freelance job and project I've worked on post graduation back in late 2023. This is the first project that taught me the importance of database design. Besides that, this project also gave me the first opportunity to work with people that I don't know

projects.title: Text Classification for Climate Change
projects.summary: Computer Science Thesis Manuscript Text Classification Project.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Text Classification of Climate Change Tweets using Aritifical Neural Networks, Fasttext Word Embeddings, and Latent Dirichlet Allocation

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Wrote the thesis manuscript with LaTeX, and the documentation & implementation of the thesis

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: The final task of the Computer Science undergraduate college program.

projects.title: Lu Factorization Calculator
projects.summary: Single Page Application that solves the L and U matrices for a given matrix.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Solves the L and U matrices for any 2x2, 3x3, or 4x4 dimension matrix

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Implemented the solution in C

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This is the final group project for a Math Elective course Numerical Analysis. I implemented the solver in C and then the is converted to JS and deployed in Vercel groupmates. The solution for finding the determinant was implemented by my groupmates.

projects.title: QuickGrade
projects.summary: Web Application Tool designed to help teachers automatically check exams.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Web Application designed to help teachers properly check different types of exams with the help of Image Processing (OCR) and AI (LLMs). Properly checks fill in the blank, enumeration, multiple choice, and essay type questions.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Found a solution to properly check multiple choice exams. Contributed on the backend by using Amazon Textract to scan handwritten exams, to extract questions and its answers, then using this info for Prompt Engineering to pass to GPT-3.5 Turbo to properly check & score the given exam.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This a project I joined during my time in Symph as an intern. This was also one of my first projects to work on to integrate with AI and OCR technologies and using both together

projects.title: Image Processing Library
projects.summary: Collection of Image Processing Techniques done from scratch.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Compiled Image processing activities that demonstrate how different image processing techniques are done.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Developed image resize, image recolor, image rotate, shape recognition, and letter classification from scratch

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This is an activity compilation of my Intelligent Systems / Computer Vision course in college.

projects.title: Chat App
projects.summary: Mobile Chat Application that implements the basic requirements for a Chat App.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Basic Chat Application where Users are able to sign up and have their account verified in order to login and use the app. Users are able to search for other users by searching the name or email of the user that they want to add and chat with.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Search and converse with other users by searching their name or email. Implemented: Splash Screen, Conversation page, User Search, and Authentication & User Account Management & Message Storage through Firebase integration

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This is the final project output required in my Mobile Development course.

projects.title: Calculator App
projects.summary: Mobile Calculator Application that features basic arithmetic.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Calculator application that handles simple arithmetic, namely addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Implemented simple arithmetic operations, and basic error handling (Catching typical errors such as dividing by zero, reaching infinity, etc.).

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This was a midterm exam output for my Mobile Development Course.

projects.title: CPU Scheduling Visualizer
projects.summary: Console application that demonstrates CPU scheduling algorithms.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Visualizes and simulates CPU Scheduling Algorithms through a GANTT Chart given the number of processes, and the time slice/quantum for each process. Features CPU Scheduling Algorithms such as First Come First Serve (FCFS), Nonpreemptive Shortest Job First (NSJF), Preemptive Shortest Job First (PSJF), Round Robin, and Priority Scheduling.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Implemented the entire solution.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This was the final project for my Operating Systems course back in college

projects.title: Timbertrack
projects.summary: Inventory Management System for the local company "Tony's Lumber and Construction Supply".

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: A Solution developed for Tony's Lumber and Construction Supply to stray away from pen and paper inventory management. It features the requested features sales dashboard, stock management, and subcategorization of products. Implements user roles, with different roles having different permissions.

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Implemented CRUD functionalities, and pages with different Inventory Management System features. Developed: Sales Dashboard, CRUD for most resources, and Sub-categorization for products. Developed most of the backend.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This a project I joined during

projects.title: Chess App
projects.summary: Simple Java application to demonstrate Chess logic.

descriptions.heading: Description
descriptions.description: Basic chess piece movement demonstration with all chess logic and rules

descriptions.heading: Contribution
descriptions.description: Implemented most of the chess rules, such as pawn & piece movement, castling, en passant, promotion, check, and checkmate. Also implemented basic UI features such as highlighting the squares in the chess board where the pawn or piece is able to legally move to.

descriptions.heading: Discussion
descriptions.description: This was the final project submission for my Object Oriented Programming course in college.
